paragraphs.text: Tangier, located on the northwest coast of Morocco on a bay of the Strait of Gibraltar, seventeen miles from the southern coast of Spain and 140 miles northeast of Rabat, held significant strategic importance . Its location made it a key point for intercontinental trade, diplomacy, and military control . The city had experienced multiple occupations throughout its history, including by Phoenicians, Carthaginians, Romans, Vandals, Byzantines, and Arabs .

The Portuguese presence in Morocco began with the taking of Ceuta in 1415 . Portugal's early African expansion was driven by economic motivations, strategic interests, and religious zealotry . Attacks against Tangier occurred between 1433 and 1464 . In 1437, Duarte I launched an attack against Tangier, but the expedition was a disaster . The city of Ceuta was invaded by Portuguese troops in 1415 .

Tangier surrendered to Portuguese forces in 1471 under the rule of Alfonso V . The "Entrada en Tánger" (Entry into Tangier) occurred on August 28 and 29, 1471, and depicted the peaceful occupation due to the city's abandonment . The Portuguese occupation extended for more than two centuries and was marked by important events . The King of Portugal captured Arcila, Tangier, and Alcázarquivir, fortifying them and imposing a yearly tribute on nearby populations . The Portuguese King employed skilled German bombardiers in Alcázarquivir .

The Portuguese presence in the area led to the construction of numerous fortifications: walls, towers, bastions, fortresses . The Portuguese rebuilt the walls of Arcila and fortified them with towers and a watchtower . The Castelo in Tangier had round medieval cubelos at each angle except the south, which had a square keep (torre de menagem) . The square keep resembled the one in Arzila, with three stories, a battlemented platform, and corner bartizans . Around 1514, the platform on the north-east wing of the main corps de logis was likely transformed into a fully roofed top floor . Renaissance chimneys present in the Civitates view were gone by the mid-seventeenth century . A fountain or well was possibly located in the middle of the Castelo yard . A Portuguese hornwork with two half-bastions was erected to reinforce the Castelo novo's east curtain, likely in the 1560s during a modernization phase .

The Portuguese adapted the fortification model to pyroballistics during their presence in the area . The Portuguese presence in Safi impacted the Borj El-Bahar (sea castle), a historical monument dating back to the 16th century . The Borj El-Bahar is in a poor condition due to marine erosion, possibly accelerated by the expansion of the Safi port .

The death of King Don Sebastián in the Battle of the Three Kings resulted in Portugal passing to Hispanic sovereignty under Felipe II until 1644 . Ceuta was annexed by Spain in 1580 after the Portuguese defeat in the Battle of the Three Kings . Despite regaining its independence around 1640, Portugal failed to recover Ceuta .

In January 1662, King Charles II acquired Tangier from Portugal as part of the dowry for his marriage to Catherine of Braganza . Tangier was ceded by Portugal to England in 1661 . The Anglo-Portuguese Alliance is often dated from the Treaty of Windsor of May 9, 1386, or the treaty of June 16, 1373 . The alliance was in abeyance from 1580 to 1640 .

Dutch and Spanish-backed forces of al-Ghailan aimed to seize Tangier during the hiatus of the Portuguese to English transfer of ownership . Lord Sandwich's squadron was present in Tangier Bay since October 10, 1661, but lacked the leverage to expedite the handover from Governor Don Luis de Almeida . The defeat of a Portuguese raiding party on January 12 left the town of Tangier virtually undefended . Almeida appealed to Sandwich for assistance after the January 12th Portuguese raiding party defeat . Sandwich sent ashore 80 seamen under Vice Admiral Sir Richard Stayner to secure Tangier . Sir Richard Stayner first occupied York Castle and seized other key installations in Tangier . Tangier was secured by Stayner's actions a fortnight before Lord Peterborough's arrival on January 29 . Stayner left Tangier late in June 1662 and died in Lisbon in early October .

After the Portuguese handover, Tangier became an English outpost from 1661-1684 . Englishmen initially hoped Tangier would become a prosperous trading center and a base against Muslim corsairs . The English crown established Tangier as a free port and crown colony . A proclamation was issued on November 16, 1662, declaring Tangier as a free port . The free port of Tangier was intended to be an international free-trade environment for all merchants, modeled after Livorno and Genoa . However, Tangier was not successful as a Mediterranean free port . The English occupation of Tangier was marked by mismanagement, domestic political tensions, and Moroccan resistance . The English abandoned and demolished Tangier in February 1684 . Tangier had to resist the Moors in the 17th century while Morocco was vigorous .

The Great Mosque of Tangier was converted to a church during the Portuguese occupation (1471-1661) and was restored to its function after the Portuguese occupation . The Portuguese presence in Morocco also left a linguistic impact, with Portuguese loanwords entering Moroccan Arabic dialects .
